alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Jackson; Mellette; Oglala Lakota; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 2:08AM MST until February 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TOMORROW... .A winter storm will impact the area today and tonight, bringing heavy snow to portions of the northern Black Hills and foothills, along with much of northeastern Wyoming. On the northwestern and west central South Dakota plains, strong winds and snow will lead to slippery roads and reduced visibilities, causing travel difficulties. Snow is expected to taper off from northwest to southeast tomorrow evening into the night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Oglala Lakota County, Jackson County, Bennett County, Mellette County, Todd County and Tripp County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Pine Ridge Reservation and the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Bennett; Jackson; Mellette; Oglala Lakota; Todd; Tripp
